docs.snippet: The Whig Party held a Municipal Convention on Saturday night, and our reporter has given an outline of the proceedings thereof. It is an instructive record. It shows what meaning our most " respectable" politicians attach to the words they use about...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Whig Party held a Municipal Convention on Saturday night, and our reporter has given an outline of the proceedings thereof. It is an instructive record. It shows what meaning our most " respectable" politicians attach to the words they use about public duties, and what weight they give to the claims of the City in which they live, and with whose honor and welfare their own are so closely connected.

headline.main: NEWS FROM EUROPE.; ARRIVAL OF TIIE AFRICA. The State of the Italian Question. The Spanish Expedition Against Morocco. COMMERCIAL AND POLITICAL INTELLIGENCE.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Royal Mail steamship Africa, Capt. SHANNON, which sailed from Liverpool at 10 o'clock on the morning of the 12th inst., arrived here yesterday afternoon. The Edinburgh, from New-York, arrived at Glas. gow on the 9th inst. The London Times devotes considerable space to an article showing the prevalent feeling in France on the question of a war with England.

docs.snippet: MARSHAL, M. SMITH, the newly-appointed Consul--General to Constantinople, is in the City, He expects to take his departure for Liverpool in the Canada. Dispatches from Costa Rica represent the new Government as highly popular.

headline.main: NEWS BY TELEGRAPH.; The Consul--General to Constantinople--The New Costa Rican Government--Fraud in the Indian Reservation System--The Oregon War Debt--Dispatches from Saw Juan--Miscellaneous. AFFAIRS IN WASHINGTON.

docs.lead_paragraph: MARSHAL, M. SMITH, the newly-appointed Consul--General to Constantinople, is in the City, He expects to take his departure for Liverpool in the Canada. Dispatches from Costa Rica represent the new Government as highly popular.

headline.main: THE ANNUAL THANKS GIVING.; The Clergy on Living Topics. Conservative Tone of the Pulpit. THE DAY AND ITS INCIDENTS.

docs.snippet: A correspondent of one of your New-York cotemporaries denies that Gen. NICHOLSON is managing the organization of the House, in connection with JERE. CLEMENS-an assertion, as far as I know, never made-but admits the truth of the TIMES' dispatch in...

headline.main: NEWS BY TELEGRAPH.; The Rumored Plan for Organizing the House--What Mr. Boteler Says--The Coming Message--Mexican Items. FROM WASHINGTON.

docs.lead_paragraph: A correspondent of one of your New-York cotemporaries denies that Gen. NICHOLSON is managing the organization of the House, in connection with JERE. CLEMENS-an assertion, as far as I know, never made-but admits the truth of the TIMES' dispatch in other particulars, and its importance. Perhaps Gen. NICHOLSON would like, if he could, to have a hand in the matter.

docs.snippet: BOARD OF SUPERVISORS. VACANCIES IN THE BOARD OF REGISTRATION FILLED-BILLS AUDITED AND ALLOWED. In the absence of the President, yesterday, Supervisor BELL presided over the Board of Supervisors. Supervisor KENNEDY moved that before proceeding...
docs.lead_paragraph: BOARD OF SUPERVISORS. VACANCIES IN THE BOARD OF REGISTRATION FILLED-BILLS AUDITED AND ALLOWED. In the absence of the President, yesterday, Supervisor BELL presided over the Board of Supervisors. Supervisor KENNEDY moved that before proceeding according to the regular order of business, the vacancies in the Board of Registration be filled.

docs.snippet: The United States Mail steamship North Star, A. G. JONES, Commander, from Aspinwall on the 11th inst., arrived at this port yesterday morning. The North Star left New-York Oct. 20, at 2 P. M. On the morning of the 25th, at 4:40 A. M., she struck on a...

headline.main: FROM THE PACIFIC COAST.; Later from Central and South America. Particulars of her Disaster. ARRIVAL OF THE NORTH STAR.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Mail steamship North Star, A. G. JONES, Commander, from Aspinwall on the 11th inst., arrived at this port yesterday morning. The North Star left New-York Oct. 20, at 2 P. M. On the morning of the 25th, at 4:40 A. M., she struck on a reef near Plana Island, one of the French Keys. The weather being rainy the day previous no observation could be taken.

docs.snippet: The event of most interest during the past month has been the departure of their Majesties, the Emperor and Empress, for the northern provinces, which took place on the 1st inst. Their Majesties embarked on board the Aspa, at 7 1/?? A. M. on that...

headline.main: FROM BRAZIL.; The Imperial Journey to the Northern Provinces--Steam Communication with Europe--A Sailor Killed on Shipboard--Adjustment of the River Platte Difficulty--The Messenger-Bird.

docs.lead_paragraph: The event of most interest during the past month has been the departure of their Majesties, the Emperor and Empress, for the northern provinces, which took place on the 1st inst. Their Majesties embarked on board the Aspa, at 7 1/?? A. M. on that day, and attended by the steamers-of-war Amazonas and Belmont, proceeded directly to sea.

docs.snippet: The will of the late Robert Stephenson has been sworn to by his executors. Tile document is dated the 13th of August, 1859. The personalty is sworn under ??400,000. A cousin of the deceased is the principal legatee, receiving, besides large...
docs.lead_paragraph: The will of the late Robert Stephenson has been sworn to by his executors. Tile document is dated the 13th of August, 1859. The personalty is sworn under ??400,000. A cousin of the deceased is the principal legatee, receiving, besides large industrial interests, the house in Gloucester-square, Hyde Park, will all its valuable appointments.
